page.description: The EMAIL_POP_HEADERS() function returns only the header for message number nMessage. pSocket must be an active structure created with EMAIL_POP_OPEN().
page.prototype: Headers as C = email_pop_headers(P pSocket ,N nMessage )

argument.name: Headers
argument.description: The header of message number nMessage.

argument.name: pSocket
argument.description: A pointer variable that is populated by EMAIL_POP_OPEN().

argument.name: nMessage
argument.description: The number of the message to retrieve. Numeric

page.example:
? email_pop_open(pSocket, "mail.mycompany.com", "john_doe", "sneaky") = .T.
? email_pop_headers(pSocket, 3) = From: "Sally Doe" To: Subject: Txt attachments Date: Tue, 29 Oct 2002 08:30:26 -0500 Organization: My Company Message-ID: MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="----=_NextPart_000_000B_01C27F25.6EB6DAB0" X-Priority: 3 (Normal) X-MSMail-Priority: Normal X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook, Build 10.0.2616 Importance: Normal X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2800.1106
